FuncDef: The radius-server authorization command configures the RADIUS authorization server. The undo radius-server authorization command deletes the configured RADIUS authorization server. By default, no RADIUS authorization server is configured.
CLIs: radius-server authorization <ip-address> [ vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ] { server-group <group-name> shared-keycipher <key-string> | shared-keycipher <key-string> [ server-group <group-name> ] } [ protectenable ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IP address of a RADIUS authorization server.
The value is a unicast address in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance. This parameter is supported only in the RADIUS server template view.
The value must be an existing VPN instance name.

Specifies the name of a RADIUS group corresponding to a RADIUS server template.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters, including letters (case-sensitive), digits (0 to 9), periods (.), hyphens (-), and underscores (_). The value cannot be - or --.

Specifies the shared key of a RADIUS server.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 case-sensitive characters in plaintext or a string of 128 to 268 case-sensitive characters in ciphertext. The string can contain spaces if it is enclosed in double quotation marks (").

ExtraInfo: To better control user rights, the RADIUS protocol supports authorization of online users through an independent RADIUS authorization server. RADIUS provides two authorization methods: Change of Authorization (CoA) and Disconnect Message (DM).
